      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int[] GetIllusionActivations(float linearIntensity, float location)
      With Buzz, rather than feeling 4 discrete locations for each actuator around the wrist, it is possible to use a haptic illusion to create perceived points of vibration interpolated between the actuators.
      static int GetMotorIntensity(float linearIntensity, int minIntensity, int maxIntensity)
      Convert working in a linear perceived intensity space on [0 1] to a non-linear corresponding motor intensity on [0 255] This is done as a linear change in motor encoding value on [0 255] does not translate to a linear change in actual perceived vibrational intensity

    • Method Detail

      • GetMotorIntensity

        public static int GetMotorIntensity(float linearIntensity,
                                    int minIntensity,
                                    int maxIntensity)
        Convert working in a linear perceived intensity space on [0 1] to a non-linear corresponding motor intensity on [0 255] This is done as a linear change in motor encoding value on [0 255] does not translate to a linear change in actual perceived vibrational intensity
        Parameters:
        linearIntensity: - float on [0 1] of a vibrational intensity to be perceived
        minIntensity - int on [0 255] to anchor as the lower motor intensity for perception
        maxIntensity - int on [0 255] to anchor as the max motor intensity for perception
        Returns:
        int [0 255] for the motor encoding corresponding to the defined linear perceptual space.

      • GetIllusionActivations

        public static int[] GetIllusionActivations(float linearIntensity,
                                           float location)
        With Buzz, rather than feeling 4 discrete locations for each actuator around the wrist, it is possible to use a haptic illusion to create perceived points of vibration interpolated between the actuators.
        Parameters:
        linearIntensity: - float on [0 1] of a vibrational intensity to be perceived
        location - float on [0 1] for the location around the wrist where the perceived vibration should occur
        Returns:
        size 4 integer array of motor intensities corresponding to the vibrational output for the illusion. This can be passed to vibrateMotors in NeosensoryBlessed.
